paragraphs.zh-tw: I'm going to talk about a technology that we're developing at Oxford now, that we think is going to change the way that computer games and Hollywood movies are being made. That technology is simulating humans.
paragraphs.en: 我將向各位介紹一項目前我們正在牛津研究發展的科技 我們認為它將改變 電玩和好萊塢電影的製作方式。 這一項科技就是模擬人類，

paragraphs.zh-tw: It's simulated humans with a simulated body and a simulated nervous system to control that body. Now, before I talk more about that technology, let's have a quick look at what human characters look like at the moment in computer games.
paragraphs.en: 它以模擬的人類身體 及用以控制那身體的模擬神經系統來模擬人類。 在往下介紹這項科技之前， 先讓我們看一下現在電玩裡頭 人物運動的樣子。

paragraphs.zh-tw: This is a clip from a game called "Grand Theft Auto 3." We already saw that briefly yesterday. And what you can see is -- it is actually a very good game.
paragraphs.en: 這是俠盜獵車手 3 的片段， 昨天我們有稍微看了一些。 就如你看到的, 它是一個非常棒的遊戲。

paragraphs.zh-tw: It's one of the most successful games of all time. But what you'll see is that all the animations in this game are very repetitive.
paragraphs.en: 所有最成功遊戲的其中一個。 不過你可以看出遊戲中動畫人物的動作不斷地重覆，

paragraphs.zh-tw: They pretty much look the same. I've made him run into a wall here, over and over again.
paragraphs.en: 它們看起來都一樣。 這個角色撞上牆之後，

paragraphs.zh-tw: And you can see he looks always the same. The reason for that is that these characters are actually not real characters.
paragraphs.en: 一直重覆一樣的動作。 主要的原因是這些角色 並不是真實的人物。

paragraphs.zh-tw: They are a graphical visualization of a character. To produce these animations, an animator at a studio has to anticipate what's going to happen in the actual game, and then has to animate that particular sequence.
paragraphs.en: 他們是一個角色的圖像視覺呈現結果。 遊戲公司裡的動畫師必需先預測 遊戲中的情節， 並針對特定橋段繪製，才能製作出這些動畫。

paragraphs.zh-tw: So, he or she sits down, animates it, and tries to anticipate what's going to happen, and then these particular animations are just played back at appropriate times in the computer game. Now, the result of that is that you can't have real interactivity.
paragraphs.en: 因此動畫師只是坐在那，埋頭繪製並企圖預測將會發生的事， 而這些動畫成果會在遊戲的 適當時候播放。 但這麼做的結果是玩家無法擁有真實的互動。

paragraphs.zh-tw: All you have is animations that are played back at more or less the appropriate times. It also means that games aren't really going to be as surprising as they could be, because you only get out of it, at least in terms of the character, what you actually put into it.
paragraphs.en: 你只能不斷看到 相同的動作 這也表示遊戲中不會發生驚喜角色 只能做預設的內容 你當時放了什麼在裡面

paragraphs.zh-tw: There's no real emergence there. And thirdly, as I said, most of the animations are very repetitive because of that.
paragraphs.en: 因為裡面沒有真實的結合 所以大部份的動作只能反覆

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now, the only way to get around that is to actually simulate the human body and to simulate that bit of the nervous system of the brain that controls that body. And maybe, if I could have you for a quick demonstration to show what the difference is -- because, I mean, it's very, very trivial.
paragraphs.en: 避免的唯一方法就是實際地 模擬人體 模擬控制的神經系統 可以請你上來做個簡單示範嗎 看看哪裡不一樣 這是一個微不足道的現象

paragraphs.zh-tw: If I push Chris a bit, like this, for example, he'll react to it. If I push him from a different angle, he'll react to it differently, and that's because he has a physical body, and because he has the motor skills to control that body.
paragraphs.en: 如果我推Chris一下，他會產生反應 如果我從另一個角度推，他會有不同反應 這是因為他有一個真實的身體 和控制身體的能力

paragraphs.zh-tw: It's a very trivial thing. It's not something you get in computer games at the moment, at all.
paragraphs.en: 這是一個微不足道的 這是一個與電玩無關的小事

paragraphs.zh-tw: Thank you very much. Chris Anderson: That's it? Torsten Reil: That's it, yes. So, that's what we're trying to simulate -- not Chris specifically, I should say, but humans in general.
paragraphs.en: 謝謝你就這樣。就這樣嗎？ 是的 卻正是我們要模擬的 不是模擬Chris 而是模擬人體

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now, we started working on this a while ago at Oxford University, and we tried to start very simply. What we tried to do was teach a stick figure how to walk.
paragraphs.en: 我們在牛津大學開始一段時間了 一切從最簡單的事開始 也就是教這個火柴人走路

paragraphs.zh-tw: That stick figure is physically stimulated. You can see it here on the screen. So, it's subject to gravity, has joints, etc.
paragraphs.en: 它已經完全地模擬人體 會受到地心引力影響也有關節

paragraphs.zh-tw: If you just run the simulation, it will just collapse, like this. The tricky bit is now to put an AI controller in it that actually makes it work.
paragraphs.en: 一旦啟動模擬它就會像這樣跌倒，就像這樣 困難的部份是加入控制 也就是人工智慧讓它動起來

paragraphs.zh-tw: And for that, we use the neural network, which we based on that part of the nervous system that we have in our spine that controls walking in humans. It's called the central pattern generator.
paragraphs.en: 我們用在神經系統上的是 脊椎上控制走路的 神經網絡 叫中樞模式產生器

paragraphs.zh-tw: So, we simulated that as well, and then the really tricky bit is to teach that network how to walk. For that we used artificial evolution -- genetic algorithms.
paragraphs.en: 我們同樣模擬了這套網絡，但真正困難的是 訓練網絡走路 為此我們使用人工演化以取得自然的演算法

paragraphs.zh-tw: We heard about those already yesterday, and I suppose that most of you are familiar with that already. But, just briefly, the concept is that you create a large number of different individuals -- neural networks, in this case -- all of which are random at the beginning.
paragraphs.en: 我們昨天已聽過這個主題演講 我想大部份的人都蠻熟悉了 但是，簡單地來說， 它的概念 就是要產生大量不同的個體 以這個例子來說 起初所有個體都是亂數產生

paragraphs.zh-tw: You hook these up -- in this case, to the virtual muscles of that two-legged creature here -- and hope that it does something interesting. At the beginning, they're all going to be very boring.
paragraphs.en: 再將它們連結火柴人的虛擬肌肉 火柴人的虛擬肌肉 希望它可以做出有趣的事 一開始挺無聊的

paragraphs.zh-tw: Most of them won't move at all, but some of them might make a tiny step. Those are then selected by the algorithm, reproduced with mutation and recombinations to introduce sex as well.
paragraphs.en: 大部份火柴人不會動 但有些會走小步路 這些演算法就會被選用 加上突變和重組之後進行繁殖

paragraphs.zh-tw: And you repeat that process over and over again, until you have something that walks -- in this case, in a straight line, like this. So that was the idea behind this.
paragraphs.en: 接下來不斷重覆這些步驟 直到它能像這樣走直線 這就是它背後的概念 現在我們開始示範

paragraphs.zh-tw: When we started this, I set up the simulation one evening. It took about three to four hours to run the simulation.
paragraphs.en: 我在前一天晚上設定完畢 花幾個小時執行模擬運算

paragraphs.zh-tw: I got up the next morning, went to the computer and looked at the results, and was hoping for something that walked in a straight line, like I've just demonstrated, and this is what I got instead. So, it was back to the drawing board for us.
paragraphs.en: 隔天早晨回來檢查成果 我希望能看到它走直線 就像我所證明的一樣 但這卻是我得到的 結果它變成關節

paragraphs.zh-tw: We did get it to work eventually, after tweaking a bit here and there. And this is an example of a successful evolutionary run.
paragraphs.en: 所以我們做了些許調整 最後還是成功了 人工演化成功地運行

paragraphs.zh-tw: So, what you'll see in a moment is a very simple biped that's learning how to walk using artificial evolution. At the beginning, it can't walk at all, but it will get better and better over time.
paragraphs.en: 待會將看到一個簡易的雙足生物 藉由人工演化學習如何走路 一開始它完全不會走路 但是有愈來愈進步

paragraphs.zh-tw: So, this is the one that can't walk at all. Now, after five generations of applying evolutionary process, the genetic algorithm is getting a tiny bit better.
paragraphs.en: 這個完全不能走路 然後我們改變演算法 在演化的第五次演算它有點好轉

paragraphs.zh-tw: Generation 10 and it'll take a few steps more -- still not quite there. But now, after generation 20, it actually walks in a straight line without falling over.
paragraphs.en: 第十次演算能夠往前走幾步 但還是沒有成功 到了第二十次演算它完全成功，不但能走直線也不會跌倒

paragraphs.zh-tw: That was the real breakthrough for us. It was, academically, quite a challenging project, and once we had reached that stage, we were quite confident that we could try and do other things as well with this approach -- actually simulating the body and simulating that part of the nervous system that controls it.
paragraphs.en: 對我們來說是一個突破 這是一個很有挑戰性的計劃 一旦發展到下個階段，我們相當有信心 我們相信能以同樣的方法，讓它做其他事 模擬人體 及其控制神經系統

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now, at this stage, it also became clear that this could be very exciting for things like computer games or online worlds. What you see here is the character standing there, and there's an obstacle that we put in its way.
paragraphs.en: 到了這個階段對電玩和線上遊戲 無疑地是一個興奮的消息 你們可以看到一個角色站在那兒 在那裡我們放了一個障礙物

paragraphs.zh-tw: And what you see is, it's going to fall over the obstacle. Now, the interesting bit is, if I move the obstacle a tiny bit to the right, which is what I'm doing now, here, it will fall over it in a completely different way.
paragraphs.en: 它會在絆到障礙物時跌倒 現在有趣的是，如果現在我把障礙物挪右邊一點 就跟我現在做的一樣 它會以完全不同的方式跌倒

paragraphs.zh-tw: And again, if you move the obstacle a tiny bit, it'll again fall differently. Now, what you see, by the way, at the top there, are some of the neural activations being fed into the virtual muscles.
paragraphs.en: 再把障礙物挪右邊一點，它還是會以不同的方式跌倒 對了，畫面上方顯示的是 虛擬肌肉系統的神經運動

paragraphs.zh-tw: Okay. That's the video. Thanks. Now, this might look kind of trivial, but it's actually very important because this is not something you get at the moment in any interactive or any virtual worlds.
paragraphs.en: 以上就是我的示範影片。謝謝 這或許微不足道但卻很重要 現在的虛擬的世界 並沒有達到互動

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now, at this stage, we decided to start a company and move this further, because obviously this was just a very simple, blocky biped. What we really wanted was a full human body.
paragraphs.en: 發展到這個階段，我們決定要開一家公司繼續發展下去 這不過是一個簡單的雙足生物 我們的目標要模擬人體全身

paragraphs.zh-tw: So we started the company. We hired a team of physicists, software engineers and biologists to work on this, and the first thing we had to work on was to create the human body, basically.
paragraphs.en: 所以我們開了一家公司 聘了物理學家軟體工程師生物學家 第一個任務就是 建造一個人體

paragraphs.zh-tw: It's got to be relatively fast, so you can run it on a normal machine, but it's got to be accurate enough, so it looks good enough, basically. So we put quite a bit of biomechanical knowledge into this thing, and tried to make it as realistic as possible.
paragraphs.en: 它得輕巧以便在一般機器上執行 外觀也要準確好看 我們也加了不少生化科技進去 盡力把它做得精巧

paragraphs.zh-tw: What you see here on the screen right now is a very simple visualization of that body. I should add that it's very simple to add things like hair, clothes, etc., but what we've done here is use a very simple visualization, so you can concentrate on the movement.
paragraphs.en: 你們現在看到的是 簡易的外型可以輕易地加上頭髮衣物等 我應該要加一些簡單的東西，如頭髮、衣服等等 我們現在只是用簡單的方式 所以你們可以專注在它的動作

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now, what I'm going to do right now, in a moment, is just push this character a tiny bit and we'll see what happens. Nothing really interesting, basically.
paragraphs.en: 我們現在要做的是 輕推它一下，看看會怎麼樣 沒什麼有趣的事發生

paragraphs.zh-tw: It falls over, but it falls over like a rag doll, basically. The reason for that is that there's no intelligence in it.
paragraphs.en: 它像個布娃娃一樣跌倒 因為還沒有為它加入人工智慧

paragraphs.zh-tw: It becomes interesting when you put artificial intelligence into it. So, this character now has motor skills in the upper body -- nothing in the legs yet, in this particular one.
paragraphs.en: 如果加上會產生有趣的結果 現在它的上半身可以做很多動作 下半身則未放入任何東西

paragraphs.zh-tw: But what it will do -- I'm going to push it again. It will realize autonomously that it's being pushed.
paragraphs.en: 我現在再次推倒它 它知道自己被推了

paragraphs.zh-tw: It's going to stick out its hands. It's going to turn around into the fall, and try and catch the fall.
paragraphs.en: 它會伸出手 轉身試圖不摔倒

paragraphs.zh-tw: So that's what you see here. Now, it gets really interesting if you then add the AI for the lower part of the body as well.
paragraphs.en: 就像這樣 把人工智慧加到下半身 會更有趣

paragraphs.zh-tw: So here, we've got the same character. I'm going to push it a bit harder now, harder than I just pushed Chris.
paragraphs.en: 現在使用同一個角色 當我更用力地推它 就像我推Chris一樣

paragraphs.zh-tw: But what you'll see is -- it's going to receive a push now from the left. What you see is it takes steps backwards, it tries to counter-balance, it tries to look at the place where it thinks it's going to land.
paragraphs.en: 它會試圖抵抗左邊來的力量 你們可以看到它先退了一步 試著保持平衡 眼睛還會看向

paragraphs.zh-tw: I'll show you this again. And then, finally hits the floor.
paragraphs.en: 我再播一次 最後它才跌倒

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now, this becomes really exciting when you push that character in different directions, again, just as I've done. That's something that you cannot do right now.
paragraphs.en: 這是非常有趣的 如果你把它推向不同的方向，就像我剛剛做的一樣 這是現在的遊戲做不到的

paragraphs.zh-tw: At the moment, you only have empty computer graphics in games. What this is now is a real simulation. That's what I want to show you now.
paragraphs.en: 這裡頭可沒有預設動作 這才是真實的模擬，也就是我現在要展示的

paragraphs.zh-tw: So, here's the same character with the same behavior I've just shown you, but now I'm just going to push it from different directions. First, starting with a push from the right.
paragraphs.en: 再次現在使用同一個角色 我把它推到不同方向 第一次是往右推

paragraphs.zh-tw: This is all slow motion, by the way, so we can see what's going on. Now, the angle will have changed a tiny bit, so you can see that the reaction is different.
paragraphs.en: 這些是慢動作影片讓你們能看清楚 現在角度變了 它倒下的方向也變了

paragraphs.zh-tw: Again, a push, now this time from the front. And you see it falls differently.
paragraphs.en: 下一次我從前面推 看它跌倒的方式不一樣

paragraphs.zh-tw: And now from the left -- and it falls differently. That was really exciting for us to see that.
paragraphs.en: 從左邊推 它跌倒的方式也不同 我們對此結果感到十分高興

paragraphs.zh-tw: That was the first time we've seen that. This is the first time the public sees this as well, because we have been in stealth mode.
paragraphs.en: 這是本計畫結果第一次公開 我們還沒有讓任何人看過 因為我們是祕密進行的

paragraphs.zh-tw: I haven't shown this to anybody yet. Now, just a fun thing: what happens if you put that character -- this is now a wooden version of it, but it's got the same AI in it -- but if you put that character on a slippery surface, like ice.
paragraphs.en: 我還沒有把這個給任何人看過 現在來點有趣的 它會發生的事是 這是木頭人的版本有相同的智慧 如果把它放到平滑的冰面

paragraphs.zh-tw: We just did that for a laugh, just to see what happens. And this is what happens.
paragraphs.en: 我們這麼試只想看點滑稽的東西 而結果是這樣

paragraphs.zh-tw: It's nothing we had to do about this. We just took this character that I just talked about, put it on a slippery surface, and this is what you get out of it.
paragraphs.en: 我們不需要在它身上做什麼 只是把它 放在平滑表面就能得到這個結果

paragraphs.zh-tw: And that's a really fascinating thing about this approach. Now, when we went to film studios and games developers and showed them that technology, we got a very good response.
paragraphs.en: 這就是我們的模擬方法神奇之處 當這項技術介紹給電玩公司時 介紹給電玩公司時，我們得到很好的回應

paragraphs.zh-tw: And what they said was, the first thing they need immediately is virtual stuntmen. Because stunts are obviously very dangerous, they're very expensive, and there are a lot of stunt scenes that you cannot do, obviously, because you can't really allow the stuntman to be seriously hurt.
paragraphs.en: 他們的第一個反應是用在特技演員 因為特技很危險很貴 還有更多的特技鏡頭是做不到的 因為不能讓特技演員受傷

paragraphs.zh-tw: So, they wanted to have a digital version of a stuntman and that's what we've been working on for the past few months. And that's our first product that we're going to release in a couple of weeks.
paragraphs.en: 所以他們想要數位的特技演員 這正是我們過去幾個月來的工作 我們很榮幸能在幾個星期內發表

paragraphs.zh-tw: So, here are just a few very simple scenes of the guy just being kicked. That's what people want. That's what we're giving them.
paragraphs.en: 這裡有幾個簡單的鏡頭，一個傢伙被踢 那是他們要的，這是我們給的

paragraphs.zh-tw: You can see, it's always reacting. This is not a dead body. This is a body who basically, in this particular case, feels the force and tries to protect its head.
paragraphs.en: 你們可以看到不停地表演 一點都不僵硬，在這個鏡頭 他試著平衡也會保護自己的頭

paragraphs.zh-tw: Only, I think it's quite a big blow again. You feel kind of sorry for that thing, and we've seen it so many times now that we don't really care any more.
paragraphs.en: 另一個鏡頭又是一記重擊 你們或許為木頭人感到難過 但我們已經看了太多遍了 現在可是一點感覺也沒有

paragraphs.zh-tw: There are much worse videos than this, by the way, which I have taken out, but ... Now, here's another one.
paragraphs.en: 後面還有很多更痛的鏡頭我得拿掉 另一個

paragraphs.zh-tw: What people wanted as a behavior was to have an explosion, a strong force applied to the character, and have the character react to it in midair. So that you don't have a character that looks limp, but actually a character that you can use in an action film straight away, that looks kind of alive in midair as well.
paragraphs.en: 人們想要的是在爆炸之後 角色在空中 如何反應強大的力量 它看起來不可以軟綿綿的 它得是可以用在電影裡的角色 能飛在空中看起來有活力

paragraphs.zh-tw: So this character is going to be hit by a force, it's going to realize it's in the air, and it's going to try and, well, stick out its arm in the direction where it's landing. That's one angle; here's another angle.
paragraphs.en: 現在這個角色會被用力一擊 它會發現自己在空中 而試著抓住些什麼 它被推出去然後著地 這是一個拍攝角度，還有另一個角度

paragraphs.zh-tw: We now think that the realism we're achieving with this is good enough to be used in films. And let's just have a look at a slightly different visualization.
paragraphs.en: 我們認為達到這個程度 就已經可以用在電影上 現在我們來看點不一樣的的圖像

paragraphs.zh-tw: This is something I just got last night from an animation studio in London, who are using our software and experimenting with it right now. So this is exactly the same behavior that you saw, but in a slightly better rendered version.
paragraphs.en: 這是我昨天拿到的影片 一家倫敦動畫公司正在試用我們軟體 現在正在試驗中 它會做一樣的動作 算圖看起來比較漂亮

paragraphs.zh-tw: So if you look at the character carefully, you see there are lots of body movements going on, none of which you have to animate like in the old days. Animators had to actually animate them.
paragraphs.en: 仔細看身體每一部份 都有反應動作 不再像以往得親自調動畫 現在動作

paragraphs.zh-tw: This is all happening automatically in the simulation. This is a slightly different angle, and again a slow motion version of this.
paragraphs.en: 都能自動模擬出來 從不同角度看 用慢動作再看一次

paragraphs.zh-tw: This is incredibly quick. This is happening in real time. You can run this simulation in real time, in front of your eyes, change it, if you want to, and you get the animation straight out of it.
paragraphs.en: 這非常快即時運算馬上就能看到 你可以執行模擬 馬上調整得到結果

paragraphs.zh-tw: At the moment, doing something like this by hand would take you probably a couple of days. This is another behavior they requested.
paragraphs.en: 如果手動調動畫 大概會花去好幾天 他們還要求另一個動作

paragraphs.zh-tw: I'm not quite sure why, but we've done it anyway. It's a very simple behavior that shows you the power of this approach.
paragraphs.en: 不知道為什麼但我們還要做了 它是很簡單的動作

paragraphs.zh-tw: In this case, the character's hands are fixed to a particular point in space, and all we've told the character to do is to struggle. And it looks organic. It looks realistic.
paragraphs.en: 這個角色的手 被固定在一個地方 可以看出角色在掙扎 看起來不生硬還令人有點不舒服

paragraphs.zh-tw: You feel kind of sorry for the guy. It's even worse -- and that is another video I just got last night -- if you render that a bit more realistically.
paragraphs.en: 如果你們為他感到同情 接下來的畫面更糟，這是我昨晚拿到的片段 算圖之後看來更真實了

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now, I'm showing this to you just to show you how organic it actually can feel, how realistic it can look. And this is all a physical simulation of the body, using AI to drive virtual muscles in that body.
paragraphs.en: 只是想讓你們看看 它多麼地寫實 這全是真實模擬的結果 用人工智慧驅動虛擬的肌肉

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now, one thing which we did for a laugh was to create a slightly more complex stunt scene, and one of the most famous stunts is the one where James Bond jumps off a dam in Switzerland and then is caught by a bungee. Got a very short clip here.
paragraphs.en: 最後要介紹的是較複雜的特技 一個最有名的特技鏡頭是 007的腳被彈力繩綁住 從瑞士一個水壩一躍而下 這裡有一個簡短的片段

paragraphs.zh-tw: Yes, you can just about see it here. In this case, they were using a real stunt man. It was a very dangerous stunt.
paragraphs.en: 就如同你看到的一樣 當時用真人演出十分危險

paragraphs.zh-tw: It was just voted, I think in the Sunday Times, as one of the most impressive stunts. Now, we've just tried and -- looked at our character and asked ourselves, "Can we do that ourselves as well?" Can we use the physical simulation of the character, use artificial intelligence, put that artificial intelligence into the character, drive virtual muscles, simulate the way he jumps off the dam, and then skydive afterwards, and have him caught by a bungee afterwards? We did that. It took about altogether just two hours, pretty much, to create the simulation.
paragraphs.en: 它被週日時報票選為最令人印象深刻的特技 我看到這一幕時自問 能不能做到 實際模擬身體 利用人工智慧 並且放入人工智慧 模擬它綁著彈跳繩 高空跳下水壩 捕捉它跳下的畫面 總共花了二個小時產生模擬 接近真實創造了模擬

paragraphs.zh-tw: And that's what it looks like, here. Now, this could do with a bit more work. It's still very early stages, and we pretty much just did this for a laugh, just to see what we'd get out of it.
paragraphs.en: 結果看起來是這樣的 它只是初步階段還需要一些調整 我們會這樣握只是要讓大家笑一笑 看看到底可以得到什麼東西

paragraphs.zh-tw: But what we found over the past few months is that this approach -- that we're pretty much standard upon -- is incredibly powerful. We are ourselves surprised what you actually get out of the simulations.
paragraphs.en: 過去幾個月來 我們發現這個方法 非常強大 對於模擬的結果令人感到吃驚

paragraphs.zh-tw: There's very often very surprising behavior that you didn't predict before. There's so many things we can do with this right now.
paragraphs.en: 有些結果是我們沒有預期的 現在它可以做很多事

paragraphs.zh-tw: The first thing, as I said, is going to be virtual stuntmen. Several studios are using this software now to produce virtual stuntmen, and they're going to hit the screen quite soon, actually, for some major productions.
paragraphs.en: 第一虛擬特技演員 有7家公司已經開始使用這套軟體做數位替身 很快會在大銀幕上看到 為知名的產品做模擬

paragraphs.zh-tw: The second thing is video games. With this technology, video games will look different and they will feel very different.
paragraphs.en: 第二電玩 用這項科技會使電玩看起來大不同

paragraphs.zh-tw: For the first time, you'll have actors that really feel very interactive, that have real bodies that really react. I think that's going to be incredibly exciting.
paragraphs.en: 將是第一次角色具有互動感 它們有真實的身體對周遭做出反應 我覺得這真的令人興奮

paragraphs.zh-tw: Probably starting with sports games, which are going to become much more interactive. But I particularly am really excited about using this technology in online worlds, like there, for example, that Tom Melcher has shown us.
paragraphs.en: 或許從運動遊戲開始 將變得更有互動感 特別希望看到這科技 用在線上世界 像是剛才看到的"There"

paragraphs.zh-tw: The degree of interactivity you're going to get is totally different, I think, from what you're getting right now. A third thing we are looking at and very interested in is simulation.
paragraphs.en: 互動程度將會和現在的遊戲 大不同 第三是模擬

paragraphs.zh-tw: We've been approached by several simulation companies, but one project we're particularly excited about, which we're starting next month, is to use our technology -- and in particular, the walking technology -- to help aid surgeons who work on children with cerebral palsy, to predict the outcome of operations on these children. As you probably know, it's very difficult to predict what the outcome of an operation is if you try and correct the gait.
paragraphs.en: 我們接到很多模擬公司的詢問 其中一項計畫特別令我感到興趣，這個計畫下個月就要開始 它將使用我們行走的技術 幫助兒童腦性麻痺開刀的外科醫生 預測孩子手術的結果 你們知道 矯正腦性麻痺患者的行走的手術結果 是很難預測的

paragraphs.zh-tw: The classic quote is, I think, it's unpredictable at best, is what people think right now, is the outcome. Now, what we want to do with our software is allow our surgeons to have a tool.
paragraphs.en: 我覺得這是現下最難的 是人們的想法 我們會提供醫師另一套工具

paragraphs.zh-tw: We're going to simulate the gait of a particular child and the surgeon can then work on that simulation and try out different ways to improve that gait, before he actually commits to an actual surgery. That's one project we're particularly excited about, and that's going to start next month.
paragraphs.en: 模擬小朋友的步行 手術可以依照模擬的結果去進行 所以他可以在手術之前進行模擬 從不同的矯正結果中找出最好的，再進行手術 這就是我們特別興奮的計劃 它下個月就會開始

paragraphs.zh-tw: Just finally, this is only just the beginning. We can only do several behaviors right now.
paragraphs.en: 最後，這只是一開始的結果 我們現在只能做出幾個行為模式

paragraphs.zh-tw: The AI isn't good enough to simulate a full human body. The body yes, but not all the motor skills that we have.
paragraphs.en: 現在它的人工智慧還無法模擬全身 可以做出軀體但是還沒能做出所有動作

paragraphs.zh-tw: And, I think, we're only there if we can have something like ballet dancing. Right now, we don't have that but I'm very sure that we will be able to do that at some stage.
paragraphs.en: 不過很快它就能做出芭蕾的動作 雖然現在我們沒有芭蕾舞動作 但是我知道總有一天我們可以做出來的

paragraphs.zh-tw: We do have one unintentional dancer actually, the last thing I'm going to show you. This was an AI contour that was produced and evolved -- half-evolved, I should say -- to produce balance, basically.
paragraphs.en: 事實上我們不小心模擬出芭蕾舞蹈 這裡有一個偶然的成果是我最後想展示給大家看的 這個角色被創造時有加入人工智慧 來創造平衡

paragraphs.zh-tw: So, you kick the guy and the guy's supposed to counter-balance. That's what we thought was going to come out of this.
paragraphs.en: 當你踢它的時候它會去取得平衡 這是我們想像會是這樣的結果

paragraphs.zh-tw: But this is what emerged out of it, in the end. (Music) Bizarrely, this thing doesn't have a head. I'm not quite sure why.
paragraphs.en: 但是最後卻得到這樣的結果 (音樂) 我也不知道為什麼沒有把頭放進去

paragraphs.zh-tw: So, this was not something we actually put in there. He just started to create that dance himself.
paragraphs.en: 這不是我們設定的 這些動作都是自己發生的

paragraphs.zh-tw: He's actually a better dancer than I am, I have to say. And what you see after a while -- I think he even goes into a climax right at the end.
paragraphs.en: 他比我還會跳舞, 我必須承認 如同你所看到的 最後的動作是最精彩的部份

paragraphs.zh-tw: And I think -- there you go. So, that all happened automatically. We didn't put that in there.
paragraphs.en: 然後, 你看 這不是我們有意設計的動作

paragraphs.zh-tw: That's just the simulation creating this itself, basically. So it's just -- Thanks.
paragraphs.en: 它完全是模擬的成果 所以這是-- 謝謝

paragraphs.zh-tw: Not quite John Travolta yet, but we're working on that as well, so thanks very much for your time. Thanks.
paragraphs.en: 還不能像John Travolta那麼厲害, 但是我們會繼續努力 謝謝大家的時間 謝謝

paragraphs.zh-tw: CA: Incredible. That was really incredible. TR: Thanks.
paragraphs.en: Chris Anderson: 真的是很令人驚嘆 Torsten Reil：謝謝

title: Torsten Reil Studies Biology To Make Animation
